paper_abstract: We show that membership is decidable for languages defined by iterated template-guided recombination systems when the set of templates is regular and the initial language is context-free. Using this result we show that when the set of templates is regular and the initial language is context-free (respectively, regular) we can effectively construct a push-down automaton (respectively, finite automaton) for the corresponding iterated template-guided recombination language.
paper_title: Iterated TGR languages: Membership problem and effective closure properties (extended abstract)
